channel.title: [TUT]How to run clients on Windows 7 Computers![TUT]
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt]Tutorial on how to run clients using windows 7![/size][/center]
[center][size=8pt]Note: If this helps try repping me and Reply to help get this post stickied![/size][/center]
Ok, I have been reading some posts lately and have noticed that many people are having problems running clients saying that it shutsdown after clicking a couple of times.....
People have also said to change settings to there computer.....Or say windows 7 sucks.....
THERE IS A SIMPLE WAY TO FIX THIS. [IT ONLY TAKES LESS THAN A SECOND TO FIX] Isn't that good?
Well the problem is that windows 7 is x86 and most visa or xp computers are different. So we need a code in our Run.bat that runs off of x86.
So when you see like the code after @echo off change the thing under it to.....
[code=code]"C:/program files (x86)/java/jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx1024m client 0 0 highmem members 0[/code]
Hope this helped alot for all you windows 7 users! It helped me too when I got windows 7!
NOTE: I WAS NOT THE CREATOR OF THIS CODE SO I GIVE ALL CREDIT TO WHOEVER CREATED IT. THANKS!
CREDITS: 100% Credit to whoever created the code!

[center][size=14pt]Tutorial on how to run clients using windows 7![/size][/center]

Ok, I have been reading some posts lately and have noticed that many people are having problems running clients saying that it shutsdown after clicking a couple of times…

People have also said to change settings to there computer…Or say windows 7 sucks…

THERE IS A SIMPLE WAY TO FIX THIS. [IT ONLY TAKES LESS THAN A SECOND TO FIX] Isn’t that good?

Well the problem is that windows 7 is x86 and most visa or xp computers are different. So we need a code in our Run.bat that runs off of x86.

So when you see like the code after @echo off change the thing under it to…

"C:/program files (x86)/java/jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx1024m client 0 0 highmem members 0

Hope this helped alot for all you windows 7 users! It helped me too when I got windows 7!
